content: little birds in their nests skill level easy materials worsted weight yarn of your choice including contrasting scraps of yarn or thread for eyes and beak for birds size f 3 75 mm hook or size needed to produce a tight stuffable fabric in single_crochet for nests size i 5 5 mm hook for double-stranded nest and size k 6 5 mm hook for triple-stranded nest polyester fiberfill or other stuffing material sufficient to stuff bird firmly tapestry needle for joining embroidery and weaving ends abbreviations chain chain stitch double_crochet double_crochet half_double_crochet a method other than the chain four/join to form ring stated alternate methods i m aware of are to start with a chain two and work the first round s single crochets into the second chain from the hook and the magic_ring method described at crochetme http //crochetme com/amigurumi-double-ring use whatever technique allows you to have the smallest or preferably non-existent hole at the beginning of the work the birds and nests are worked in spirals do not join rounds each increasing or decreasing round features 6 repeats of the increase or decrease stitch pattern you may find it useful to mark the first stitch of each round this pattern can be worked with any weight yarn and an appropriate hook bigger yarn/hook will produce a bigger piece as written the finished bird is approximately 2 75 inches 7 cm tall the double-stranded nest is 1 75 4 5 cm inches across and 75 inch 1 9 cm tall and the triple stranded is 4 inches 10 2 cm by 3 5 inches 8 9 cm by 1 5 inches 3 8 cm you may want to stuff the head after completing a few rounds of the body rather than stuffing the whole piece at once this makes it easier to stuff evenly bird head and body working from top of head chain 4 join with
